column2: CALIFORNIA PRACTICE PERMIT TEST
column4: California
column6: CA

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Never make a U-turn from:
column4: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column6: the lane you’re in.
column8: the right lane.

column2: 2. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column4: there’s a narrow bridge ahead.
column6: the road is narrower ahead.
column8: you must turn right.

column2: 3. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column6: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column8: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.

column2: 4. This yellow sign means:
column4: there is a sharp curve in the road ahead.
column6: the road ahead has many curves.
column8: the road ahead may be slippery.

column2: 5. The maximum speed limit for ideal driving conditions is:
column4: the posted speed.
column6: the speed of other vehicles traveling in your direction.
column8: the speed of oncoming vehicles.

column2: 6. A law enforcement officer notices that one of your passengers is not wearing a seat belt and writes a citation. Which of the following is true?
column4: Your passenger will receive a citation, regardless of his or her age.
column6: Both you and your passenger will receive a citation.
column8: You can receive the citation if the passenger is younger than 16.

column2: 7. This yellow sign means:
column4: another road crosses yours ahead.
column6: there is a T-intersection ahead.
column8: ambulance zone ahead.

column2: 8. Large trucks are most likely to lose speed and cause a hazard:
column4: going up long or steep hills.
column6: going down long gradual hills.
column8: on long, gradual curves.

column2: 9. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.

column2: 10. This white sign means don’t pass:
column4: unless it is safe to do so.
column6: other vehicles for any reason.
column8: until after you pass the sign.

column2: 11. You just sold your vehicle. You must notify the DMV within ___ days.
12. What does it mean If an oncoming driver flashes headlights at you during a period of low visibility?
column4: Your vehicle was difficult to see. You should turn on your headlights.
column6: Your headlights are too bright. You should turn them off.
column8: Your headlights are too bright. You should use parking lights instead.

column2: 13. You are driving on a one-way street. You may turn left onto another one-way street:
column4: if traffic on the street is moving to the right.
column6: only if a sign permits the turn.
column8: if traffic on the street is moving to the left.

column2: 14. It is very important to check behind you before you:
column4: Reduce your speed.
column6: Change lanes.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 15. You must carefully watch for bicycles in traffic lanes because they:
column4: usually have the right-of-way.
column6: must ride facing oncoming traffic.
column8: could be hidden in your blind spots.

column2: 16. When they see a yellow X signal, drivers should:
column4: turn off the ignition.
column6: prepare to leave the lane safely.
column8: come to a complete stop at the marked stop line.

column2: 17. Your car stalls on the tracks at a railroad crossing, and a collision with a train is imminent. After getting yourself and your passengers out of the car, you should:
column4: run toward the train but stay off the tracks.
column6: cross the tracks.
column8: signal the train to stop.

column2: 18. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.
column6: Danger ahead.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 19. Which of these is true about other drivers?
column4: Drivers always obey traffic signs and signals.
column6: Drivers using turn signals always turn in the direction indicated.
column8: Never assume other drivers will give you the right-of-way.

column2: 20. If you are arrested for driving with a blood alcohol concentration (BAC) above the legal limit:
column4: you will be sentenced to up to six months in jail.
column6: DMV can take an administrative action against your driving privilege.
column8: you'll be required to take an alcohol-test every 3 months for up to 2 years.

column2: 21. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column6: slow down and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.

column2: 22. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.
column8: All of the above.

column2: 23. Which of these statements is true about driving and taking medications:
column4: Medications are safe to take at any time if prescribed by a doctor.
column6: Most cold medications can make a person drowsy.
column8: Over-the-counter medications cannot impair driving ability if taken in the recommended dosages.

column2: 24. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: You don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.
column6: The railroad crossing is located in a city or town that has frequent train traffic.
column8: You transport two or more young children in a passenger vehicle.

column2: 25. Never park your vehicle within __ feet of a railroad track.
column4: 7 ½

column2: 26. This yellow sign means:
column4: merging traffic ahead.
column6: lane ends ahead.
column8: one-lane road ahead.

column2: 27. This signal means:
column4: Slow down
column6: Move to the left
column8: Stop

column2: 28. Which of the following is NOT true? When driving near pedestrians:
column4: If a pedestrian makes eye contact with you, he or she is inviting you to cross the intersection.
column6: Always stop for any pedestrian crossing at corners.
column8: Do not drive on a sidewalk.

column2: 29. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column4: Service signs
column6: Warning signs
column8: Destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 30. Before getting out of your parked vehicle on the traffic side of the street, you should:
column4: look for passing vehicles, bicyclists, and motorcyclists.
column6: give arm signal that you are exiting your vehicle.
column8: turn on your left turn signal.

column2: 31. If you approach an intersection without a stop sign or signal, you:
column4: should slow down and be ready to stop, if necessary.
column6: should always stop before driving through the intersection.
column8: must yield the right-of-way to all other vehicles.

column2: 32. You wheels should be pointed straight ahead, unless you are:
column4: parked on the side of a level roadway and there is no curb.
column6: parked on a hill or sloping driveway.
column8: waiting to make a left turn at a traffic light.

column2: 33. Where should you stop your vehicle if there is no crosswalk or limit line?
column4: Twenty feet before the corner.
column6: Just pass the corner.
column8: At the corner.

column2: 34. What should you do when an aggressive driver confronts you?
column4: Make eye contact.
column6: Avoid eye contact with the aggressive driver.
column8: Challenge the aggressive driver with increased speed.

column2: 35. You want to park downhill on a two-way road and there is no curb. Which way do you turn your front wheels?
column4: So they face straight ahead.
column6: Left - towards the center of the road.
column8: Right - towards the side of the road.

column2: 36. You should adjust your rearview and side mirrors:
column4: before you get into the vehicle.
column6: before you start driving.
column8: after you start driving.
